NOTE TO NAEB STATIONS
The broadcasting of foreign language programs to elementary schools
is in the experimental stage in St. Louis* VI3IT0NS MIMI was begun
in fall 1953*
As a result of thorough evaluation of the first semester*s broadcasts
the St* Louis foreign language radio planning committee strongly re¬
commends that VISITONS MIMI, series I, be used as suggested by teachers
now using it* This means that each program is to be broadcast during
two consecutive weeks. (In St. Louis VISITONS MIMI can be heard at
five' different times'-within the weekly schedule.)
This arrangement of broadcasting the same program for two weeks per¬
mits pupils to hear the lesson at least twice; it results in better
learning and reduces the burden of drill for the classroom teacher.
Used as recommended, the series of fourteen programs covers the entire
year of instruction. A Christmas program is included as an extra
between lessons VI and VII; it can, however, be used elsewhere if con¬
venient or be omitted entirely.
Programs in this series are each ll*:30 minutes in length, exclusive of
the opening and closing KSLH announcements*
Opening cue: This is KSLH, your school station in St* Louis,
Closing cue: VISITONS MIMI originates in the studios of KSLH, the
Board of Education station in St. Louis,
In St. Louis we plan to make the following live announcement after
certain programs.
Live announcement:
And now may I remind the teachers who are using
this series that each program is being broadcast
for two consecutive weeks.
